dmca.title: [EV1-C1222654J] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VU100406-tt08
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Wednesday, October 04, 2006 8:46 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [EV1-C1222654J] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VU100406-tt08 Subject: [EV1-C1222654J] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VU100406-tt08 ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VU100406-tt08 Added by system at Wednesday, Oct 4 2006 12:46 pm X-MailFrom: ttyre@theesa.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Wed Oct 4 13:42:33 2006 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Wed, 4 Oct 2006 13:42:32 -0500 Return-path: Delivery-date: Wed, 04 Oct 2006 13:42:32 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from ttyre@theesa.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GVBhQ-0007By-9U for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 04 Oct 2006 13:42:32 -0500 Received: from dns2-nj.paetec.net ([63.138.37.3]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from ttyre@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GVBh2-0009Kz-BH for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 04 Oct 2006 13:42:08 -0500 Received: from hook.theesa.COM (mail.theesa.com [63.138.80.34]) by dns2-nj.paetec.net (8.13.6/8.13.6) with ESMTP id k94IfP6f016145 for ; Wed, 4 Oct 2006 14:41:30 -0400 (EDT) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5.7226.0 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6E7E4.B1E91B99" Subject: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VU100406-tt08 Date: Wed, 4 Oct 2006 14:41:25 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VU100406-tt08 thread-index: AcZEjzjpxkji1VLXS0ajrgOIx5zzkijSP3lw X-Priority: 1 Priority: Urgent Importance: high From: "Timothy Tyre" To: Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 63.138.37.3 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of theesa.com) client-ip=63.138.37.3; envelope-from=ttyre@theesa.com; helo=dns2-nj.paetec.net; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 04 Oct 2006 18:42:32.0892 (UTC) FILETIME=[DA5FF7C0:01C6E7E4] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 USA Attention: Intellectual Property Enforcement Telephone: 202-223-2400 E-mail: dmcaresponse@theesa.com October 4, 2006 Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc., The Entertainment Software Association ("ESA") is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as "ESA members"). ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein. ESA is providing this notice pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and 17 USC § 512 (c) to make ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive copyright and other rights of one or more ESA members. This notice is addressed to you as the agent designated by ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. to receive notifications of claimed infringement. ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 67.19.194.20 infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale or download unauthorized copies of game products protected by copyright, or offering for sale or download material that is the subject of infringing activities. The copyrighted works that have been infringed include but are not limited to: http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/STAR.zip (Warez): StarCraft contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/W2BN.zip (Warez): Warcraft II Battle.net Edition Contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/D2DV.zip (Warez): Diablo II contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/D2XP.zip (Warez): Diablo II expansion contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/WAR3.zip (Warez): Warcraft III contraband. The unauthorized copies of such game product(s) or the material that is the subject of infringing activities appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address. Those items are listed and/or identified thereon by their titles or variations thereof, game-related listings/references/descriptions, or depictions of game-related artwork. Such copies, titles, game-related listings/references/descriptions, depictions, and material that is the subject of infringing activities are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material." Based on the information at its disposal on October 4, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. to immediately do the following: 1. Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material. 2. Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above. 3. Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender. ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate. Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein. ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred. Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence. Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter. Sincerely, Intellectual Property Enforcement Entertainment Software Association ---------------------- Timothy S. Tyre Anti-Piracy Associate Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 Phone: (202) 223-2400 Direct: (202) 903-2314 ttyre@theesa.com MIME element (text/html)

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004 USA

 

Attention:  Intellectual Property Enforcement

Telephone:  202-223-2400

E-mail:  dmcaresponse@theesa.com

 

October 4, 2006

 

Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.,

 

The Entertainment Software Association (“ESA”) is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as “ESA members”).  ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein.

 

ESA is providing this notice pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and 17 USC § 512 (c) to make ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive copyright and other rights of one or more ESA members.   This notice is addressed to you as the agent designated by ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. to receive notifications of claimed infringement.

 

ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 67.19.194.20 infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale or download unauthorized copies of game products protected by copyright, or offering for sale or download material that is the subject of infringing activities.  The copyrighted works that have been infringed include but are not limited to:

 

http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/STAR.zip (Warez): StarCraft contraband.

http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/W2BN.zip (Warez): Warcraft II Battle.net Edition Contraband.

http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/D2DV.zip (Warez): Diablo II contraband.

http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/D2XP.zip (Warez): Diablo II expansion contraband.

http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/WAR3.zip (Warez): Warcraft III contraband.

 

The unauthorized copies of such game product(s) or the material that is the subject of infringing activities appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address.  Those items are listed and/or identified thereon by their titles or variations thereof, game-related listings/references/descriptions, or depictions of game-related artwork.  Such copies, titles, game-related listings/references/descriptions, depictions, and material that is the subject of infringing activities are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material."  

 

Based on the information at its disposal on October 4, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. 

 

Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. to immediately do the following:

 

1.   Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material.
2.   Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above.
3.   Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms

      of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender.

 

ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate.  Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein.  ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred.  Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence.

 

Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter.

 

Sincerely,

 

Intellectual Property Enforcement

Entertainment Software Association

----------------------

Timothy S. Tyre

Anti-Piracy Associate

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004

Phone: (202) 223-2400

Direct: (202) 903-2314

ttyre@theesa.com

 

MIME element (text/plain)
